info.title: Installing Rivendell on an RHEL-7 System

sect2.title: Overview
sect2.para: This technical note contains procedures for installing the Rivendell Radio Automation System on a system running RHEL 7.x derived distributions. Such distributions include:
Installing Rivendell on these platforms consists of three primary steps:

listitem.para: Install the base distribution and establish an Internet connection.
Bootstrap and run the installation script.
Secure accounts and finish up final details.

sect2.title: Prerequisites
sect2.para: The following items are required to complete the installation.

listitem.para: Target hardware. 64 bit (x86_64) AMD or Intel architecture is supported.
A generic installer image for the distribution. DVD, Network and USB installation sources are all supported.
A basic working knowledge of how to install vanilla RHEL 7.x. Consult the documentation of the particular distribution for more information.

sect1.title: Installing the Base Distribution
sect1.para: Install the base distribution in 'Minimal' mode.
Set the root password, but do not create any other users.
When basic installation is complete and after rebooting, log in as user root.
Then run the command:
This will print a list of available network connections, looking something like:
To autoconfigure a connection via DHCP and bring it up, run the following commands:

para.userinput: nmcli conn mod name ipv4.method auto

sect1.para: Where name is the name of the connection to use, from the list above --.e.g. eth0.
To start a given interface and assign IP parameters manually, give the following commands:

para.userinput: nmcli con mod name ipv4.addresses ip-addr/prefix ipv4.gateway gateway-addr ipv4.dns "dns1-addr dns2-addr"
nmcli conn mod name ipv4.method manual

sect1.para:
Where ip-addr is the IP address to use, prefix is the netmask prefix, gateway-ip is the gateway IP address and dnsX-addr are the DNS server address(es). (If you are used to specifying a netmask in the more common 'dotted.quad' notation, a 'cheat sheet' that provides prefix values for the most common values is available at
https://www.aelius.com/njh/subnet_sheet.html).
Once the network has been initialized, the settings can be made persistent by the command:

para.userinput: nmcli con mod name connection.autoconnect yes
